meanings.definition: A device that combines several signals into one signal for transmission.
meanings.sent1: The multiplexer helped merge different signals into a single one for sending.
meanings.sent2: The technician used the multiplexer to blend various signals into a unified transmission.
meanings.sent3: At the signal party, the multiplexer was the popular guest who mixed everyone's messages together.
meanings.sent4: The multiplexer acted like a traffic cop, directing all the signals into one smooth flow.
meanings.sent5: With the multiplexer, it was as if all the signals held hands and traveled together as one.

meanings.definition: A device that selects one of several input signals and forwards it to a single output.
meanings.sent1: The multiplexer chose the strongest signal from many inputs to send out.
meanings.sent2: In the control room, the multiplexer picked the clearest input to transmit.
meanings.sent3: The multiplexer was like a signal DJ, spinning different tunes to the output.
meanings.sent4: Like a gatekeeper, the multiplexer only allowed one signal to pass through at a time.
meanings.sent5: The multiplexer was the conductor, deciding which signal got the spotlight on stage.
